intro: Pseudocentrum, commonly known as the white star ginger, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and consists of several species, many of which are cultivated for their ornamental value. The plants are characterized by their striking, white, star-shaped flowers and broad, lance-shaped leaves. They thrive in humid, tropical environments and require well-drained soil. Pseudocentrum species are often used in horticulture for their aesthetic appeal and are relatively easy to care for in the right conditions.
